review: Not memorable. Had the blue ribbon burger and steak fries. The burger was okay but looked preformed. If you are going to call yourself a burger place don't serve me frozen French fries!

I kinda wish I manned up and took a stab at Amarillo's 72oz steak challenge! -From a pure burger perspective, it's not very good, but the overall sandwich was  good.  Fries were dissappointing -Service, specifically at the bar was very good -Restaurant was clean -beer was delicious -Price: tough to comp it - compared to shake shack, In n out, etc, it's very expensive.  compared to other chain restaurants, I suppose it's pretty much in-line.  The burger was sized well, but smaller than other chains, so I think from a value perspective, it's not good. I've always wanted to try red robin, because it's usually ranked pretty highly in various blogs, burger challenges, and such.  I was rather excited when it was right next to my hotel.  I had no idea they had a full menu, which I guess is pretty cool.  That said, I was here for a burger, so the only decision really was choosing between the 8 or so variations they had on the nice, clean laminated menu.  I had my eyes on a few of them, and ultimately decided to go with the whiskey bbq burger.  Sounds like a solid choice, right?  My thoughts exactly.  Read on to empathize with my dissappointment.  I place my order and the anticipation builds.  The friendly barkeep brings me over a bigass glass of really, really cold, draft beer.  I am thinking it's shaping up to be a good day.  Five or so minutes later, a plate with my meal arrives. First glance, everything looks in order, nice place of thick steak fries.  Quickly go for one of them and in an instant, my mood changed drastically.  Not because I am bipolar, but as i bit into the soft, lukewarm, tasteless fry, I realized I am eating frozen supermarket fries that have not been cooked long enough.  I tried to buck up and think that well, the whole slogan "yummm" is about their burgers, and doesn't really encapsulate the fries.   ....drink half of my cold beer to try and put the french fry experience behind me..... So I try the burger, and further sank into a very melancoly mood.  I mean, I thought that's what Texas did...beef!!....they give you two choices, medium or medium well.  I opted for medium yet was served a a charcoal brick.  A thin one at that.  It's kind of comparable to like Five Guys or Mcdonalds or Taco Bell - where y ou know it tastes great, but it's not because it's good meat, it's the whole concotion.  It's not really a true burger experience, but just the whole thing with fried onions and whiskey BBQ sauce all over.  The bun was OK, kind of tasteless, almost stale, but it was def solid in composition, but without the character of say, a nice piece of ciabatta.  that said, Ill take that over something lacking structural integrity and crumples easily.   So from a true, pure, burger afficando persepctive, it fails.  Miserably.  From a grab a couple buddies, drink beer and have something that tastes good and is fun to eat, it's very passable, athough I would'n't say it surpasses a Chilis kind of thing.   But fries kind of complete the experience, and that wasn't good.   As i mentioned earlier, regarding price/value, it's tough to come up with what an accurate comparison should be.  Put it against shake shack (sorry, I believe the nearest shake shack to you guys is in the Woodlands, or even Phoenix) or in n out, it fails by being substantially more expensive.  Put it up against a chain restaurant, and I think it doesn't pack enough weight to compare.  Overall, it doesn't seem to be a good value.  I would think that many local bar and grills would be a better option.   From a chain point of view, I believe there was an Outback nearby, which I would much rather prefer on taste, value, and awesome fries.  they also serve good beer at the bar and have that awesome bread to start off with.   With all that being said, maybe it was a little hit or miss and I happened to have it on an off day.  Perhaps my particular food server had alot on his or her rmind that day, so said server was off their game.  Happens to me too.

Awsome burgers, the service was fast friendly. Food was hot good,juicy,tender. Called in an order was ready in 15 min.  Got a free beer while I waited the lol 3 min for my food. Servers are friendly busy but fast. Went in around 6:30 pm. Clean and fun Go for great food and some fun & sports.

I know this is a chain and there's always room for improvement but here goes.... This was my first Red Robin burger. I love a good burger. It was very good. Especially with blue cheese. And the raspberry tea is yummmmmy.  But I'm really reviewing this particular location for the staff. Friendly, very friendly. Attentive. Not under staffed by any means. Of course it was Black Friday and we got there right at 11am. But no one seemed mad that they had to work that day.  Locals should unite and support this place.

Chain burger at its finest. Had the double Red Tavern burger with bacon and was a little underwhelmed by the size. Fast and friendly with attentive service an hour before close. Would pick this over any fast food if you have a craving for an affordable burger.

I could not be more grateful for the service received on 2/5/14 by Jaime.  We were on a road trip back to Vegas.  There was a horrible snow storm outside & we stopped here just for a break from the weather.  Hubby and I cant stand chain restaurants but considering we were on a road trip home, we didn't have too many options. We both work in  the serving industry at 5 star, 5 diamond resorts in Las Vegas, therefore, we truly appreciate impeccable service when do receive it.  Thank you to Jaime for the unexpected service!!  You were awesome!!!!!!!!!!!!

I so want to give this place the benefit of the doubt. And I also realize I was coming in close to closing time on Sunday night. But... This is what I experienced. And all of it points to poor management  Example number one: employees sitting at the bar drinking. Number two... Stepping over piles of swept up trash from the floor en-route to your table. Example 3 at least 10 tables not having been bused up after patrons have left. By the way multiple employees are milling  about during this time not lending any kind of hand towards cleaning any of the tables. I stopped here to eat after driving all day so I had to use the restroom. I took a picture of the bathroom with the towels piled so high it was almost comical.  Let's talk about the food got the red Robin Burger nothing special french fries lukewarm. Once my food was served I had to ask for silverware to eat with. I report...you decide.  Today April 19th Got a follow up phone call from Jason (I assume the manager) after this post. His primary concern was how did I know that employees were drinking at the bar. I now know why this place is like this...Hello, anyone home!

I have eaten here a number of times, and had I written this review the first two or three times it would have been five stars.  The quality has been better than average since then, but the last visit was terrible.  The burgers just didn't taste right, as if they had been cooked on a dirty grill.  That said, the waitress was outstanding, and the sweet potato fries were excellent.  I'll give it another shot, but if it is terrible again, it will be my last visit.

Terrible service. Gross and disgustingly filthy bathrooms. The burgers weren't bad but UGH, the bathrooms were almost as bad as army field latrines.  They need to clean, disinfect and regularly stock the supplies.  Because of this I cannot advise going here.
We always have a pleasant visit while here. I like the food. The California club is one of my favs

I made a stop at the Red Robin in Amarillo yesterday & while I love their burgers  I wouldn't recommend ordering an appetizer. This has been a reoccurring problem & not just recent.  I had ordered 7 boneless wings on top of a bed of chips topped with onion strings. Instead I received 4 wings with bone-in minus the onion strings. Not getting the onion strings wasn't a big deal. But getting 4 with bones instead of 7 boneless is part of an ongoing problem at this location. I've had appetizers that came out warm or cool and/or incomplete.  A guy seated behind me cancelled his appetizer because it took too long to come out. Another guy seated outside on the patio brought his check in & paid his waitress on the way out since he hadn't seen her for a while.  I had ordered the Banzai Burger & fries with a side of Campfire Sauce. The Banzai was fine, the fries were lukewarm & the Campfire Sauce was missing. I didn't even bother bringing it to the bartenders' attention. She was sweet enough to reorder my wings for me & not charge me for the wrong ones.  I'm a fan of Red Robbin but not in Amarillo. There's too many places to eat in this town. Especially if you want a burger. I'm not sure if the order is put in wrong or if the kitchen is inept. Either way paying $10.99+ for a burger & fries is way too much to be incomplete & of questionable quality.

We were traveling through Amarillo and looking for a place to stop for lunch. I was excited to find out they were gluten free friendly. Online we saw they had an allergen menu and offered gluten free fries. When we arrived, I was handed a card with the online allergen menu. It was easy to navigate, but I quickly found out that the location didn't offer all the options on the menu. The waiter seemed annoyed with our accommodations and wouldn't go talk to the kitchen about the options on the allergen menu. Finally made decisions they could accommodate.  My plate of food came out and it was incorrect. When we told the server that the food was wrong he questioned us as if there couldn't possibly be a mistake. Once the food was delivered it was good. My boyfriend said it was the best gluten free bun he's had.

The friendly host and server couldn't  have been any nicer BUT I ordered a Ketel One and tonic 2 minutes later..."we're out of Ketel One." Ok, I'll take a Tanqueray and tonic. 2 minutes later..."we're just opening a new bottle of tonic." Ok. 2 minutes later..."we're out of tonic." If you know Monty Python, you'll understand the next reference when I asked, "this is a cheese shop, isn't it?" My chicken salad came quickly, hot and tasty, but I admit that I'm afraid to order a hamburger.
For what it is this place is pretty good. They were good enough to serve us at 10-till closing time and didn't complain that we stayed a while.
Great service and amazing food!! The prices are just right and the drinks have amazing variety.

Typical Red Robin. Food was good and server was friendly enough. However, she was verrryyy slow and didn't notice refills (and forgot once when we asked). I would have given 3 stars except the manager came by twice to check on us and was very helpful. She brought refills, extra napkins and even replaced our malts for free when someone said they weren't very "malty".  Overall a fine place to eat if you get a faster server.

Arrived between lunch and dinner, entire restaurant is virtually empty, despite this, it takes someone five minutes to acknowledge our presence and once seated and we have ordered, it takes right at fifty five minutes to receive our food. You'd think with a three year old toddler and a nine year old they'd offer crackers or something for the kids to eat in the mean time.......no they don't. Then the food comes, regular fries are stale and luke warm, my burger has cheese on it which I asked them to not put on the burger, my three year old's plate had a slice of jalapeño on it!!! Both managers are sitting down eating....... Finally a manager comes by and I very politely inform them of everything I've already mentioned here and they apologies and very politely offer us all dessert. That helps but you know what, it will be another eight months before we go back. Kids and wife's food was good, wife's sweet potato fries were good and fresh.   Since this original post, corporate and a service manager have reached out to assure me they are coordinating with this location to insure this doesn't happen again and offering me a family complimentary trip back to Red Robin to show their appreciation for bringing this less than sterling visit to their attention.

Red Robin - Sunday 10.18.15 - 1:00pm Travis and I met his mom and her boyfriend at Red Robin just after 1pm.  They already had a booth in the back.  The place was booming and our waitress, Selena, did an amazing job.  Not only did she make friendly conversation, she made menu suggestions and she even helped me sign up for the rewards program. We ordered the Poutine appetizer.  I was skeptical because I love the dish at IDK and I was worried I would be disappointed.  Luckily, this dish in a class of its own - IDK serves a more traditional Poutine and this appetizer had a lot of extra frills such as mushrooms and a garlic aioli.   It was a delicious departure from the classic. I had the Red's Tavern Double - Pig Out Style (bacon and more bacon) with lots of campfire sauce on the side.  Trav's mom had the same.  Travis ordered the Banzai Burger and his mom's date had the Smokin Pepper burger.  I only heard "mmmmm" during our meal.  Everyone was happy.  Burgers were cooked appropriately, buns were hot and fresh and the toppings were plentiful.   Trav and I split a Boozy Jack Daniel's Vanilla Malt for dessert and it was strong and tasty, as always. We love Red Robin and Selena made this trip one for the books!

My wife and I stopped here to grab a meal to go on our drive from Denver, CO, to Wichita Falls, TX. I called it in about 20 minutes before we got there, my wife wanted a Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Wrap with crispy chicken. I ordered a guacamole burger without tomatoes.  I arrived and walked in to pick up our order and the host staff seem confused. I spotted a bag of food that looked like it was probably our order and eventually the two hosts discovered it. Then they were going to give it to me without paying for it, haha. Only when I offered did they get the bartender so I could be charged.  I got in the car and my wife and I continued our 10 hour journey. We immediately discovered that the chicken was not correct, and I had tomatoes on my burger. Granted, the food was well prepared, this was disappointing. I grew up in California where we had several Red Robin, and now in Wichita Falls we have none. So I was very excited to stop here. To my dismay it was a mediocre trip.

Last time I went into the Red Robin in Amarillo I was robbed. Left my debit card out on the bar waiting for the bartender to pick it up and one of the waitresses walked behind me with her phone and took a picture of it. My bank called me and asked if I used it at Walmart to buy 200 dollars worth of stuff, not to my knowledge. 215 dollars for a so-so blue cheese burger is a little pricey.
The banzai burger is always great. Tried the crab burger and it was good but not my favorite. They are pretty expensive for a burger.  Wait staff was fantastic.
My family and I go there a lot on Sunday's. We never have to wait for a table and the service is always fast and great. Food is awesome. Rewards program is the best. Great for kids!

Went for a friends Birthday, we all ordered, took over an hour to get food and up to an hour and 45 minutes for some food to come out, could not get refills on drinks or fries, and the waitress would disappear for 15 minutes. It wasn't even busy, I can only imagine how long the wait would be if it was busy. Will not go back at all and will not recommend this place.

Subpar food... Wait let's start at the beginning! It took a few minutes to seat us even though there were only 5 tables seated at the time we arrived. After we were seated we waited an additional 20 min to be greeted by a server who said nobody picked you guys up... So the manager told me to get y'all. Well that was fine.... Too bad the manager couldn't show some concern and apologize since you know the waiter didn't .... Anyways food was subpar  and service was mediocre. Just kind of went through the motions. While we were here there were three other table that complained of either service or food. Get it together Red Robin in Amarillo!

Like this place because it's family friendly and great choices for everyone's taste. Always friendly staff and the atmosphere is nice. My hang up is for a chain they sure do run with lots of bumps. It should run like a well oiled machine but there seems to always be issues with something every time we go. This last time my bottomless floats came so slow that I got two which is really all one needs minus one. The bottomless fry's, they give you like 10 in the first place and then it seems impossible to get the refill. The table behind us was having issues and as I looked around many other tables were as well so I think there was just a back up in the kitchen. We gave up on waiting for the fry's. They finally arrived after the check. Last little thing was the kids meals didn't come like the pictures so if you have kids you know they decide based on a picture and when the food comes out different hat doesn't go over well. Luckily the food tasted very good and they got over that it didn't look like the picture and ate it. :) overall the food was good and the staff was friendly, they just need to get it together. :)
Good Bacon Cheese Burger with O. Rings... good service and they serve Diet D.P. (which is a plus for me).

Wow! You should never expect too much out of a franchise location. However, one thing that you can count on in a cookie cutter establishment, is consistency. Not at the Amarillo location! Our family generally goes there 6 -7 times a year, mainly to get the fish and chips. Never in my wildest dreams would I have ever thought that someone would use tempura batter on "Fish & Chips" WTH? I have never complained about their food or service this time...what a mess! The fish tasted like it was heated up in a microwave. My burger was over cooked! The bartender that waited on us was attentive and sweet. Everything else was disappointing.

Ordered the $15 salad. Took 35 minutes. Then got a bed of dry greens. A sprinkling of corn and a 1/2 chicken breast with a glop of BBQ sauce. Not even 1/2 of the ingredients on the menu. Needs improvement.

My friend and I went for our lunch break so we were limited on time. I have only been once and it was years ago. Our waiter was awesome. Can't remember his name but he had a pretty thick beard. We decided to try the Buzz Mac n Cheese burger. This was wayyy out of the box for me. It was AMAZING! Then he offered this campfire sauce for the steak fries. I don't know what that sauce was, but it was delicious. Overall, the service, the food, the experience was great! I highly recommend!

This is a great restaurant to sit and enjoy a meal but Don't order to go. We always stop at this location when traveling. Today we decided to place a to go order instead of staying. BIG MISTAKE The food is packed up and placed at the bar. Because of this the food is NOT left under a heat source of any type to keep it warm. We actually arrived at the restaurant before the time given. We have no idea how long the food had been sitting there at the bar. It was so cold and not worth eating. We would have been better off eating at McDonalds because it would have been so much cheaper for cold bad food!

Worse service ever just walk in to get some food stood and waited for a table with no help or assistance on how long or even if there is a table ready. The worse part of it all is the manager was right in front of us the Talking to his fellow worker about there own non business stuff. I had to ask if there was going to be a table or not and he finally replied they cleaning our table, well I would not mind eating for my table to be cleaned but I do mind that we are not being informed or anything about what's going on and I have to ask while they are having there chats in front of me the customer waiting to find out what the hell is going on and to top it off I can't even call the manager to complain because it's the manger treating us like this. We waited there for 10 min with no information nothing not hey sorry they cleaning your table or we are waiting on a table nothing just chilling and having there chats like we Re sitting in there living room. People go out to eat pay money so that they can be treated and won't have to do it themselves at home. I would rather cook myself food than pay money to a company who staffs people so inconsiderate for the clients.

So I wish I would have seen some of these reviews before eating here. We had a really good experience at this Red Robin a few years ago and coming from miles away -- we really looking forward to eating here.  We were seated quickly and all seemed to go well until we noticed that we were not being served as often as other tables. As we sat waiting for our food we noticed the people in front of us, who were seated around 10 minutes after us, got their food in a prompt manner while our waitress (who was nice and not rude at all) was no where to be seen.  After finally getting our food, my mother, who got the salmon, found that it was not grilled as advertised but fried and was way overcooked (my guess is that it was cooked on the flat top grill they used for cooking burgers and so they 'think' that means grilled but that's like frying on a pan and not grilling over a flame). My mom returned the burnt one and got another one--but later didn't eat that one either. Just imagine a flat and fried piece of salmon laid on a browning piece of lettuce... and then having to pay $13 for that. Thankfully, they did take that item off my mom's ticket. My dad and mine's burgers were also sub-par (for a burger place)... flavorless meat, hardly any toppings, and fried toppings were greasy. In agreeing with what some of the other people have said it just seems like the idea of service (even from the manager) is that the customers are the inconvenience and it's just a place to hang out with each other. Could be wrong or maybe it was a weird period, but this was our experience. And I really hope this gets fixed because this used to be an old stand-by.
Worst burger ever.  Inedible burger burnt and dry.  They got the order wrong twice.  Service slow and uninterested in service

Probably the most expensive horrible burger I have ever eaten. Burnt and dry. My husband upgraded to the sweet potato...he got less than a handful. Only thing that was even decent was our server. Haven't went to a Red Robin in ages...definitely won't ever make the mistake again.

I am very hard to please, and yes 3 years ago we had a mediocre experience. But we went in today and it was excellent! We had the onion ring tower and everyone got burgers and they were fresh, flavorful, moist and delicious! Truthfully a great experience! We will most definitely be back and know that the new management is really putting their all into the food and atmosphere. Very family friendly and relaxing. Great seating and clean surroundings.

The staff were friendly, and the food tasted great...just like many other Red Robin's that we've visited. Removing one star because even though the staff was fun, personable, and helpful, our server only came back to check on us at the very end of our meal. There were a couple of refills that we would have liked filled during the visit, but was only able to get one...and then ended up packing it because our kids were antsy and done. Maybe he didn't come check on us because (we later discovered that) you can "call" the waiter/waitress to your table with a blinking light on the mini tablet on the table...and we didn't notice it till the end.

Stood at the front waiting for 10 minutes to be sat... had 4 employees.. a bartender, bus boy, and two servers see us.... and no one offered to seat our family. So we left. If I were the owner of this establishment I would be livid.

We checked into the Hilton Homewood Suites in Amarillo Texas on our way to Albuquerque. My husband had a hamburgerhamburger and steak fries which were fabulous but hamburger was mediocre. I ordered tortilla soup and a salad. The salad was OK but the soup was horrible. The soup was not clear broth but some sort of sticky gravy stuff. Pretty much ate some of my husbands steak fries. I did have the lemonade frosty with no alcohol and it was fabulous

Nice clean looking restaurant. I had the bacon cheeseburger and it was good, my girlfriend had the fish and chips and the fish was great. We will come back. Our waitress was named Brandi and she did a fine job.

*receipt showing vegan burger included in photos In summation, if you choose to eat here either order over the phone for vegan options or contact the manager directly in order to confirm what you are getting as our food did not match our order. We ordered 2 vegan burgers on their to go menu online. After we arrived home from picking up the food, we noticed a dairy looking topping. We called Red Robbin and were informed it was dairy. When we returned to get a refund the manager stated they didn't have the vegan burger and that it was a "veggie build". This was an interesting statement as their veggie burger has a bun and our burger had a lettuce wrap as it states on their to go menu for only the vegan burger. The "veggie build" includes a bun not a lettuce wrap. The vegan burger on their to go order did not include any dairy in the description, yet our vegan burger had tomatoe aioli (dairy) on it.  The manager condescendingly asked if I was dairy intolerant which seemed extremely ignorant and insensitive for a company selling a vegan burger. As if she was implying the only reason to not want to consume dairy was because of an allergy. We are Vegan hence we don't consume dairy for a number of reasons. Regardless, we ordered something without dairy and expected them to hold up their end of the deal by not including dairy.  Additionally we ordered the garlic herb fries (no parm), there were no herbs. Online it states the vegan burger comes with broccoli which was also missing. The manager did apologize several times and gave us our money back. However this was a huge hassle. It was also irritating that even though we could order a vegan burger online, the manager stated they didn't actually have a vegan burger at this location and were given the "veggie build" (this didn't add up as the veggie build has a bun and our burger had a lettuce wrap) and the manager implied the only reason to not want food with dairy was due to a dairy allergy. This is very condescending towards vegans. We would possibly try this location again if we were able to confirm our order and they became more vegan friendly.
